view

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
      • view.Button
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GUI.RestartButton, GUI.StepButton, SideBar.IncrementButton, SideBar.OnOffButton, SideBar.RepairButton, TextButton, ToggleButton

    public class Button
extends java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
    A basic button. It has 3 states, idle, mouseOver and pressed. Need to register the button using renderer to make sure it receives mouse messages. Need queue for rendering every frame to make sure it appears on the screen. Override doAction method to associate specific functionality with the button
    Author:
    Tadas

    • Constructor Detail

      • Button

        public Button(java.lang.String imageName,
      int posX,
      int posY,
      int width,
      int height)
        Initializes the button.
        Parameters:
        imageName - file name of the image. It will be stored as an AnimatedRenderable with 3 frames internally and the image itself should reflect that.
        posX - position of the top left corner of the image representing the button
        posY - position of the top left corner of the image representing the button
        width - width of the button
        height - height of the button

        boolean checkIfIntercepting(int x,
                          int y)
        Checks if the specified coordinates are within the area of the button.

        y -
        Returns:
